Topic.Title: 3 yrs revenue up $5B stock up 100% in 3 yrs

Message.Msg: "does a 5% reveune gain in 3 yrs warrant a 100% share price increase?" Your question is an oversimplification. Try looking for other financial differences. Do your own DD. Nobody likes a troll.

Message.Title: China services growth slows sharply, adds to recovery risk Reuters
Message.Msg: China services growth slows sharply, adds to recovery risk Reuters

Topic.Title: China services growth slows sharply, adds to recovery risk Reuters

Message.Msg: China is expected to slow to 7.5% GDP in Q2. The US probably won't break 3%. The sequester and the start of Obama-care may slow the US down going into Q4. I like defensive stocks like IBM, VZ, T and US REITS. When times get tough IBM's annuity revenue starts to look relatively good. Let us not lose sight of 2009 in the wake of Lehman Bros and the Great Recession. IBM pulled it out in 2009 and had a beautiful 2010. It's the US that needs to pick up.

Topic.Title: Long term holders of IBM should welcome a priced drop...

Message.Msg: You have a reading comprehension problem. Seriously you do. "IBM at $200" is a present tense statement. That means now - IBM is around $200 now. So it's like AAPL back when AAPL was at $700.
